result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruth Marie Babbs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ruth Marie Babbs in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Ruth Marie Babbs.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Second call: Same appearances. Court informs the parties a lower pending case has been selected. Court vacated today's Jury Trial  and ordered matter adjourned.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ruth Marie Babbs in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Ruth Marie Babbs.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial . 
First call: Case remains in trial posture.  Parties are ready to proceed. Case passed to address Court's calendar.

Defendant Ruth Marie Babbs in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case scheduled for Jury Trial.  First call:  Parties ready to proceed. Court proceeding with another trial.  Court adjourned Jury Trial date. Case remains calendared in Br. 30.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.
State's Requested Jury instructions received and filed.

Defendant Ruth Marie Babbs in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final-pretrial. Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled on 06/06/22 at 9:00AM, in person, in Branch 30.
Jury trial on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
At the request of the Court, Jury trial is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ruth Marie Babbs in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruth Marie Babbs appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for defense's motion to modify the no contact order. Arguments heard. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 30. Final Pretrial is scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30am. Jury Trial is scheduled for June 08, 2022 at 09:00am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/15/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DME.

Defendant Ruth Marie Babbs in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference AND Bail/Bond Hearing in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 2p
